cab.content: SECRETfj ifEXCHANGE OF PRISONERS OP WAR. Admiralty Memorandum for the War Cabinet.The War Cabinet at their meeting on 28th May respecting the exchange of prisoners of war, decided (far Cabinet 419 Minute 1.0) that the question as to what Delegates should represent the British Government should be further considered by the War Cabinet after receiving the views of the Admiralty and the far Office in the matter.In the opinion of the Admiralty, several of the subjects tc be discussed at the Conference concern Naval matters sc intimately "that the Delegates should include a Naval Representative, They have, therefore, proposed that Captain H,K0 Kitscn,' RflNe, Assistant Director of Naval Intelligence should be one of.the British Delegates and that he should be accompanied by Mr RUIU Gunn as his personal assistant, I beg tc submit the appointment for the approval of the War Cabinet.(Signed) R0EU WJY3S.5rd June, 1918,7 '
